title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Darling Ingredients Inc

content.text: Darling Ingredients Inc. was formed in 2002 through the merger of Darling International Inc. and Griffin Industries. This merger allowed the company to expand its operations and product offerings.
In 2003, Darling Ingredients Inc. executed a 2-for-1 stock split. This split doubled the number of outstanding shares but did not affect the overall market value of the company.
Darling Ingredients Inc. acquired VION Ingredients, a leading European organic waste recycling company, in 2005. This acquisition further enhanced the company's presence in the global market.
A 2-for-1 stock split was implemented by Darling Ingredients Inc. in 2012. This split aimed to increase the liquidity and accessibility of the company's shares.

Darling Ingredients Inc. acquired Rothsay, a Canadian rendering company, in 2014. This acquisition solidified the company's position as a global leader in converting organic waste into sustainable ingredients.
In 2016, Darling Ingredients Inc. changed its corporate name from Darling International Inc. to Darling Ingredients Inc. This name change reflected the company's wide range of products and services.
Another 2-for-1 stock split took place in 2017, increasing the number of outstanding shares and improving market liquidity.
Darling Ingredients Inc. acquired EnviroFlight, a leading insect protein and oil manufacturer, in 2020. This acquisition added another sustainable ingredient source to the company's portfolio.
